dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clint looks at the house.

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I know what you want to say. You're sorry. Have regrets. You're tired of the badgering. The pestering. (incredulous) You can't just fucking wake up one day and forget about it... -..Pretend it isn't there. When something becomes a part of you... ..-Like your arms and legs, an appendage you can't live without. It's there forever. Forever. It was there when you were born. (beat) Before you were born. This is your last chance to deal with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clint continues to look at the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A door SQUEAKS within the dark stairwell. FOOTSTEPS descend. WATER dripping from somewhere below. Water hitting water. A PAIR of shoes descend a couple of steps. A startling BANG! from above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clint as he stands on the steps. Checks behind him, up the steps towards the sound.

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Don't worry about them. One generation after another. Still moved by what we did to those girls.

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (reminiscing) Those girls. So sweet. Remember? They know you'll do it again. (beat) So do you. STAIRWELL. Clint forgets about it. Continues down the dark, wet stairwell into 4. EXT. PARK. DAY. Several TEENAGERS surround CLINT (30s), threatening.

dialogues.speaker: CLINT
dialogues.text: I didn't do anything! It wasn't me! They close it. One throws a punch. TEENAGERS beat him. Clint lying on the ground ina fetal position. Trickle of blood from his nose. He lets out a silent scream.

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Time has a funny way of hiding things. Making them disappear. (beat)  Gives us the false sense of change when none exists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moving boxes here and there. The tops forced over, bent. Taped haphazardly, like a child did it. A plain unmade bed against one wall. Clint stands in front of a wall mirror. Cracked and broken. Can't tell whether it is day or night outside the room. Windows covered by old blankets. Putting on a button-up shirt, Clint shows off his extensive, BURN SCARS. Scars covering most of his torso and arm. Runs his hand across them.

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You're fucking disgusting. Look at you. You look like lunatic. Who would want you? I'm the only one ever there for you. BEDROOM. On the empty night stand a medicine bottle. HALOPERIDOL across the front with instructions. Clint does his best to tape up a moving box. Goes to another. Stops. Takes out several newspaper clipping and old photos. The headline on one newspaper cover reads, Гўв‚¬Е“Distinguished surgeon's 16-year old disable son suspect in gruesome murder." A photo of the crime scene below the headline. The OLD NEON COKE SIGN in the background. The old mansion's basement. Takes the old newspaper piece lights it with a lighter, throws it in a metal trashcan allowing it to burn. Next, a small trophy, and a couple of first place  ribbons. Childhood memories. They too, go into the wastebasket. Several Polaroid PHOTOS are next. Shows a FATHER and MOTHER and two young sons, one older and bigger than the other, in baseball uniforms. Clint stares at the photos. Emotionless.

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You gonna cry? No one cried for you. Nobody was there for you. Except for me. Go ahead, cry. Faggot. Clint throws the pictures in the trash. It, too burns with the newspaper clipping. 6. INT. BASEMENT. DAY. Clint turns on the lights. He looks at the table. He touches the chair. 7. EXT. STREET. DAY. Details of Olivia, the first victim. 8. INT. OLD DEMPSEY MANSION. DAY. Clint stares at the table. Noises of rocks hitting the outside wall. Window breaks. 9. EXT. OLD DEMPSEY MANSION. DAY. A RED OLDSMOBILE and an OLD MERCEDES sit in the drive. "Sold" realtor's sign in the grass. A grand old place. Forgotten about. Weeds knee high, paint coming off the once, majestic walls. Windows broken. The front door with graffiti of all kinds across it. "Killer". "Your next". "Get out". And other profanities.  TWO TEENAGERS throw stones at the house, breaking a window. They run away.

dialogues.speaker: INT. RESTAURANT. DAY
dialogues.text: Clint sits alone at a booth, in the corner. Still wearing his funny winter hat and coat. Digs at his shoe's sole with a stick. Knocks chunks of dirt and feces on the floor around the table. A WAITER(20'S), plain but pretentious, brings a bottle of beer. Stops. Looks down at the pile of crap beneath Clint. Disgusted. Leaves the beer and goes without saying a word. A WAITRESS(18)the young college type, catches Clint's eye. She smiles. She's got a pair of black tights and YELLOW LEG WARMERS on.

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You got a looker. Go ahead. What's it gonna hurt? Show me that will power. Clint looks away at nothing, avoiding the moment.

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We need to see if we still have it in us.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What do you think? One fifteen, one twenty? KEVIN(40'S), a young version of the father in the photo, sits next to Clint. He's the All-American ex- football type. Clint looks up to see his brother approaching. Looks away as if hiding something. Avoids Kevin's stare.

dialogues.speaker: CLINT
dialogues.text: Hey, Kev.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: She can't weigh over a buck twenty five.  (looks at Clint's shoe) That shit? (sniffs) Kevin eyes the dirt pile formed on the ground. Clint looks down.

dialogues.speaker: CLINT
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: That's disgusting, little brother. Kevin waves the cute waitress over.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: (just out of earshot) The things I could do to her. She approaches, he puts on his charm.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Draft beer, darling. She smiles, flirting. She looks down at the pile of shit on the ground. Unfazed by it.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: You know you can't bring feces in here, unless it's ona leash. Clint turns to avoid talking to the waitress. She waits for a response.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Well... (looks at Clint) I didn't see the sign. Clint looks around for the imaginary sign.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: You haven't been paying attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have no idea. Kevin gives her his best charming smile. She it. He's won.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: Right. Draft beer it is. The waitress eyes Clint. Clint continues to act like she isn't there.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: Another for your friend?

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: No. He's driving.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: As you wish. She leaves. Kevin watches her walk away. His eyes locked on her ass.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: You get the house ready? Clint looking at the wall, the posters.

dialogues.speaker: CLINT
dialogues.text: Yeah. It's ready. I don't know about this, Kev.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: You did your time like a man, Clint. Nothing else you can do. Hey... The older brother gets close. Puts a hand on his Clint looks at Kevin.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: (quiet) Forget about it, little brother. The past is gone. The only thing that matters is right now. Who you are now. Who we are. returns cheek.  (beat) This is our chance to start again. Like new. Tonight we finish where we left off. Listen, we'll take care of things at the house. Tomorrow start fresh. Together. A family. Like we used to be.

dialogues.speaker: CLINT
dialogues.text: I don't know. Kevin removes his hand from Clint's face.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: You need me, little brother. Like I need you. Laurel and Hardy. Batman and Robin. Remember? By Clint's demeanor, he gives in to his brother's charm.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Uncle Clint! A young, girl ZOE (11) rushes up to her uncle, Clint. Jumps on him. Clint allows it. Clint's face lights up. Changes his demeanor suddenly.

dialogues.speaker: CLINT
dialogues.text: Hi, Zoe. You're big.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: You know we're coming with you tomorrow, right?

dialogues.speaker: CLINT
dialogues.text: Sure do. (smiles) I'm excited.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: I wanna show you my new dance!

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: 10 Get over here, Zoe. Uncle Clint doesn't need you all over him. Reluctantly, Zoe obeys. Gets down from Clint's lap. Her mother, BRENDA(40'S), approaches. Her face wrinkled from the years of being angry. From her demeanor, she isn't pleased to see Clint. Clint retreats mentally.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: She's been dying to see you. More than the table between them. The separation obvious. An uncomfortable moment. Brenda eyes Clint. She doesn't budge.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Ready, Kevin? The Waitress approaches with a beer. Notices Kevin's family. Lost the bubbliness she had moments before. All business now.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: Draft beer. Four fifty. Kevin hands her a ten.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Keep it. She takes it without saying anything else.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: (to Brenda) Gimme a minute. Zoe close your ears. Zoe puts her hands over her ears.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: That cunt didn't say thank you.  11

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Kevin! Please. Kevin downs the beer in one go. BURPS. Zoe uncovers her ears. Kevin gets up to go.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: (to Clint) You want to ride with us now?

dialogues.speaker: CLINT
dialogues.text: No. I can drive.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: I know you can. Just worry about my little brother's all. (rubs Clints head) We leave at eight. Don't stay out too late. We still have work to do at the house. (beat) You didn't leave me too much to pack, I hope.

dialogues.speaker: CLINT
dialogues.text: Just what's in the basement.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Good. Be a good boy.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: Bye, Uncle Clint. Clint smiles at the girl. Waves half-heartedly. Drinks the last swallow of beer. Readies himself to leave.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You're brother's a dick. The waitress takes Kevin's empty beer mug.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: Guess you got the looks and the personality.  12 She smiles. Waits. Her flirting has turned to Clint. Clint finishes putting on his jacket. Can't help but look at the girl. Smiles. Leaves quickly, embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This is your last chance to deal with it. So fucking deal with it.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. RESTAURANT. DAY
dialogues.text: Clint leaves the restaurant and goes into his car, waits inside.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. OLD MANSION. DAY
dialogues.text: An SUV sits parked in the drive. Engine off. The RED OLDS sits parked next to it.

dialogues.speaker: INT. SUV. DAY
dialogues.text: Kevin sits in the passenger seat. Looks towards the door of the house. Surveys the damage done by vandalism. The broken windows. The front door.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Your brother creeps me out. You see the way he looks at me? At Zoe. He isn't right. He killed that girl, Kevin.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What's wrong with him, mommy? Uncle Clint couldn't hurt anybody, right Daddy?

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Mommy's got diarrhea of the mouth, honey.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: I'm just saying. Your brother is a convicted killer.  Wouldn't it be better if it were just us...

dialogues.speaker: ZOE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What's wrong with Uncle Clint, daddy? Is he retarded like mommy says?

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: (calm) I hear what you are saying, Brenda. I hear the incessant whining. The complaining. Your excuses for this and that. Your pathetic reasons for being unhappy. I'm going to act like I didn't hear that. I'm gonna act like you are a real person for once. 13 Brenda turns away. Looks out the window, avoiding Kevin. Kevin gets close, whispering in her ear.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Though, you talk like that again about my brother, my family and you will be sucking food through a straw. Believe that. (to Zoe, easier) No, honey, there's nothing wrong with your Uncle. Mommy had a temporary lapse in judgement.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: She's sorry she said that. (to Brenda) Ain't that right, dear? He kisses her on the cheek. He opens the door, there looking in.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: stands  14 Tomorrow we start the next chapter in our lives. Together. As a family. Brenda not turning towards him.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Bye, daddy! 14. EXT. HOUSE. DAY. Kevin goes into the house

dialogues.speaker: INT. SUV. DAY
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON her face shows tears welling up in her eyes. She holds it in. Kevin closes the door. Waves by. As soon as the door closes, Brenda puts it in reverse and gets the hell out of there. 16. INT. OLD MANSION. BASEMENT. Kevin wanders through the basement. Kevin eyes the table and cement floor. Where the bodies once were.

dialogues.speaker: INT. MERCEDES. DAY
dialogues.text: Clint sits watching the rear-view.

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We wait. We talk to her is all. See what happens.

dialogues.speaker: WE GET A LOOK
dialogues.text: At the restaurant through the back window of the vehicle. The winter cold begging to come in. Clint still sitting, checking his rear-view. THE BACKGROUND blurry. A unidentified RED CAR crosses within the view of the back window and parks out of frame.  15 Through the windows of the restaurant the waitress grabs a jacket, leaves. She exits and crosses the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We play it cool. Ask her what she likes to do. If she wants to go for a drink. Clint notices her in the rear view. Checks the side mirror.

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We go now if we are going. He waits a moment before opening the door of the car. We watch him move to the back of the car, stop at the trunk, open it. 18. INT. BASEMENT. DAY. Kevin takes a black case and unfolds it. 19. EXT. MANSION. DAY. Kevin drives away. 20. INT. MERCEDES. TRUNK. Clint rummages through the trunk looking for something.

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I told you we should've prepared for this. Clint finds what he's looking for. A half-used roll of DUCT TAPE and a TIRE IRON. Closes the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. RURAL ROAD. DAY
dialogues.text: The old Mercedes cruises through an rural, two-laned street. Mostly farmland surrounding it.  16

dialogues.speaker: INT. MERCEDES. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Clint drives. Checks the rear view every now and then. Something up ahead causes him to panic.

dialogues.speaker: CLINT
dialogues.text: Shoot. Shoot. Shoot. Road Construction. Slowing traffic in front of him. Several WORKERS waving flags. Clint pulls right next to one of the FLAGMEN. So close the guy could stick his head in the window, if it were open. Clint avoids eye contact. Finally past. Clint checks his rear view again. Leaving the road annoyance behind. Turns his head to get a look into the back seat.

dialogues.speaker: THE WAITRESS
dialogues.text: Bound and gagged lying on her side. She squirms. Muffled BREATHING through the duct tape. Fear in her eyes. The old Mercedes drives along a similar, rural, two- laned road.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. ROAD. DAY
dialogues.text: The Mercedes pulls around. Clint sits in the driver's seat. Tire iron in hand. Checks the rear view. The waitress's face.

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: At least cover the back seat.

dialogues.speaker: CLINT
dialogues.text: I'm so tired of feeling like this. I hate who I am. Clint breaks down.

dialogues.speaker: CLINT
dialogues.text: 17 Why did you kill those people? I hate you. I hate you. Why? What did I do!? Clint's cries for help turn to anger. He grabs the steering wheel and shakes it violently, as if trying to pull it out of its place.

dialogues.speaker: CLINT
dialogues.text: I can control you. They're wrong. Wrong. I choose to listen to you. Follow your suggestions. My will over your instinct. (crying)

dialogues.speaker: CLINT
dialogues.text: I just wanted to do right. Be good. That's all I ever wanted from you. Let me know I'd done good. (to girl) I'm not going to hurt you. I would never hurt you. It wasn't me that did it. I don't want to hurt anyone.

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What are we having a pity party for Christ's sake? Get a hold of yourself. Clint grips the handle of the tire iron. Prepares himself. The woman's scared face in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Get on with it.

dialogues.speaker: CLINT
dialogues.text: It will never end. You will never leave me alone.

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Oh, for fuck's sake! Do it! You poor excuse for a...  18 BAM! Without hesitation, Clint takes the tire iron and bangs it against his own head. Does it again. BAM! Killing the voice. Blood runs down his temple from beneath his winter hat. Clint sits there a moment. Gets his bearing. A UNEXPECTED RAP on the window breaks the tension. Startled, Clint turns to look. Through the driver's side glass, A POLICEMAN, about the same age as Clint, waits. Taps the window with the antenna of a RADIO. Motions for Clint to roll the window. Clint does reluctantly. The cold air rushes in.

dialogues.speaker: CLINT
dialogues.text: Hi, Oscar. The policeman leans down, gets a good look into the car, at Clint. Notices the trickle of blood down the side.

dialogues.speaker: POLICEMAN
dialogues.text: Everything okay, here? Are you injured.

dialogues.speaker: CLINT
dialogues.text: F-fine. Everything is fine. The Policeman holds his gaze on Clint's face for what feels like forever. He then moves line of sight throughout the front seat. Holds on the tire iron a moment. He slowly scans towards the back seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shows an empty back seat. He scans the length of the backseat. Nothing there.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Clint stares straight ahead. Waits for the Policeman to visually move through each corner of the Mercedes. Finally back on Clint's face.

dialogues.speaker: POLICEMAN
dialogues.text: You know this ain't a place to be hanging out. Where's your brother? You want me to call him?

dialogues.speaker: CLINT
dialogues.text: (quick) No.

dialogues.speaker: POLICEMAN
dialogues.text: Everything okay at home? Everything okay with your brother?

dialogues.speaker: CLINT
dialogues.text: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: POLICEMAN
dialogues.text: Things can get real tough out here. Man like you. Being in prison and all. Shame what happened to you back then. Sorry if I was ever mean to you. Nothing from Clint. He's avoiding the familiar Policeman's stare.

dialogues.speaker: POLICEMAN
dialogues.text: Good to have you back, in any case. Just take care of what ever you need to take care of. But do it back at home. Not safe out here right now. Till things cool off for you. Clear?

dialogues.speaker: CLINT
dialogues.text: Clear.

dialogues.speaker: POLICEMAN
dialogues.text: You be safe, Clint. Clint rolls the power window. 19  20 The policeman walks towards his waiting police cruiser. Clint watches the Policemen walk towards the rear of the Mercedes, get in his running vehicle.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. OLD MANSION. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Clint's Mercedes pulls to the curb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clint goes into the basement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An overhead light gently swings from the middle of the room. Beneath it, a table with the naked outline of a woman's body. The shadows obscuring her torso and face. YELLOW LEG WARMERS on her legs. On a smaller table, a pair of hands unrolls a bundled white roll. Within it, metal instruments. Saws, metal scalpels, other cutting devices within smaller pockets. The person's identity hidden within the dark shadows.

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE/KEVIN
dialogues.text: What took you so long?

dialogues.speaker: CLINT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE/KEVIN
dialogues.text: I was going to start without you. Clint's voice coming from the stairwell. His shoes visible in the light. He descends the steps slowly. Kevin reaches over and pushes the towards the stairwell, illuminating Clint coming down the steps. He lets it go, it swings back and forth over the woman's naked figure.  21

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin sits over the small table, inspecting his tools.

dialogues.speaker: CLINT
dialogues.text: I don't want to do this, Kev.

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE/KEVIN
dialogues.text: Remember our first girl? Coffee colored hair. A hint of red in her cheeks from the cold.

dialogues.speaker: FLASH OF IMAGES
dialogues.text: Of a woman's flowing hair, rosy cheeks. Clint takes a moment to reminisce.

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE/KEVIN
dialogues.text: Touch of perfume. Clint inhales, closes his eyes taking in the imagined smell.

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE/KEVIN
dialogues.text: Fifteen years I've waited for this moment. For our time together. We're a family again, little brother. Isn't it great? Clint puts his hands on his ears. Squeezes his eyes closed.

dialogues.speaker: CLINT
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE/KEVIN
dialogues.text: It's okay, little brother. Don't be ashamed of what we did.

dialogues.speaker: CLINT
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE/KEVIN
dialogues.text: You could have stopped it anytime you wanted. But you didn't.

dialogues.speaker: CLINT
dialogues.text: You're wrong.

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE/KEVIN
dialogues.text: You can't just wake up one day and forget about it. Pretend it isn't there. Clint approaches the table slowly.

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE/KEVIN
dialogues.text: This is who we are, little brother. Kevin pulls a sharp instrument, a curved knife. Runs a sharpening stone across it.

dialogues.speaker: CLINT
dialogues.text: I suffered in that place... for you.

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE/KEVIN
dialogues.text: I suffered the fifteen years you did for both of us, little brother. I was alone, like you. Believe me, I suffered immensely. Clint moves around the table, towards his brother who continues sitting. Runs his hand the short end of the table. Inspects the peaceful face of the unconscious waitress.

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE/KEVIN
dialogues.text: We are together again, finally. Like a family. Clint calmly walks right up to Kevin. Standing within arms reach now.

dialogues.speaker: CLINT
dialogues.text: I don't want to do this, Kev. Clint turns to look at his brother. They are now face to face except Clint standing over his older brother. 22  23

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE/KEVIN
dialogues.text: You can't change it, little brother. You're a convicted killer.

dialogues.speaker: CLINT
dialogues.text: It wasn't me.

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE/KEVIN
dialogues.text: It's in your blood. Same as mine. Instinct versus will. Instinct wins every time. I love you, Clint. You are everything to me. They stare at each other a moment. The swaying overhead light behind them. The outline of the girl's body beneath it.

dialogues.speaker: CLINT
dialogues.text: I don't want to do this, Kev. Kevin's demeanor changes in an instant. Possessed by an unseen evil.

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE/KEVIN
dialogues.text: You gonna fucking cry again? Without emotion, Clint swings the crowbar, hitting Kevin in the side of the head, instantly splitting his skull, spilling blood. Kevin falls to the ground. With a contained fury, Clint hits Kevin's body multiple times. Blood splatters his face with each THUD. The swinging stops as suddenly as it began. Clint just stands there. Stares at Kevin, unmoving.

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You can't just forget about it. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It is there forever. It was there when you were born.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before you were born. THE END. 24
